intro: Tabernaemontana corymbosa, commonly known as the fragrant star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of star-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers that emit a sweet, intoxicating fragrance, especially at night. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic properties. Tabernaemontana corymbosa is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes other ornamental and medicinal plants.
